intro: Diostea cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow with white ray florets, blooming in spring and early summer. Diostea cinerascens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
